title: John Antoon
text:
John C. Antoon II (born May 16, 1946) is a <a href="United%20States%20federal%20judge">Senior United States District Judge</a> of the <a href="United%20States%20District%20Court%20for%20the%20Middle%20District%20of%20Florida">United States District Court for the Middle District of Florida</a>.
Early life and education.
Antoon was born on May 16, 1946 in <a href="Bakersfield%2C%20California">Bakersfield</a>, <a href="California">California</a>. He received his <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Arts">Bachelor of Arts</a> <a href="Academic%20degree">degree</a> from <a href="Florida%20Southern%20College">Florida Southern College</a> in 1968, his <a href="Juris%20Doctor">Juris Doctor</a> from <a href="Florida%20State%20University%20College%20of%20Law">Florida State University College of Law</a> in 1971, his <a href="Master%20of%20Science">Master of Science</a> from <a href="Florida%20Institute%20of%20Technology">Florida Institute of Technology</a> in 1993, and his <a href="Master%20of%20Laws">Master of Laws</a> from the <a href="University%20of%20Virginia%20School%20of%20Law">University of Virginia School of Law</a> in 2001.
Career.
Antoon was a <a href="prosecutor">prosecutor</a> for the <a href="Cocoa%2C%20Florida">City of Cocoa, Florida</a> from 1971 to 1972 and was in <a href="Practice%20of%20law">private practice</a> from 1971 to 1984. He was an <a href="Associate%20attorney">associate</a> with Gleason, Walker, Pearson, and Shreve (1971) and as a <a href="Partner%20%28business%20rank%29">partner</a> with Shreve, Antoon, and Clifton (1972–1974), Antoon and Clifton, P.A. (1974–1976), and Stromire, Westman, Lintz, Baugh, McKinley, and Antoon, P.A. (1976–1984). He served as an assistant <a href="public%20defender">public defender</a> for the <a href="Florida%20Circuit%20Courts">Eighteenth Judicial Circuit of Florida</a> from 1972 to 1976 and a circuit judge of the Eighteenth Circuit from 1985 to 1995. Antoon served as a judge on the <a href="Florida%20Fifth%20District%20Court%20of%20Appeal">Florida Fifth District Court of Appeal</a> from 1995 to 2000.
Federal judicial service.
<a href="President%20of%20the%20United%20States">President</a> <a href="Bill%20Clinton">Bill Clinton</a> nominated Antoon to the <a href="United%20States%20District%20Court%20for%20the%20Middle%20District%20of%20Florida">United States District Court for the Middle District of Florida</a> on February 9, 2000, to the seat vacated by <a href="G.%20Kendall%20Sharp">G. Kendall Sharp</a>. <a href="Advice%20and%20consent">Confirmed</a> by the <a href="United%20States%20Senate">Senate</a> on May 24, 2000, he received <a href="Letters%20patent">commission</a> on May 31, 2000. He took <a href="senior%20status">senior status</a> on June 3, 2013.
